entry.title: Family Journal 559AZ: Happy Holidays
entry.content:
Don't forget to remind me - I still need to do a jump in the lake. This time at least it will be easy to find parking.

Happy CV-19 holidays!  This year  everyone is virtual (not just the holidays, but literally all year), which is great as our family is naturally virtual first, and having everyone be really good at video calls, and video calling software getting better and better is a boon for us!  We actually used the software I built to make some "virtual selfies". Here's our christmas call: 

I also get to make virtual boogers - did I mention I love my job: 


Zach spent some time, though certainly not the majority of time, being nice to Amelia. We all cherish those moments: 


Amelia also lost her first tooth, which she's very proud about. She's been talking about her 'wiggly tooth' for about 2 months.



I spent some time cooking, did I mention how much I enjoy souse vide and baked potatoes? 





Zach also has the cooking gene, he loves making "boomer burgers", which are really regular burgers, but with an alliteration, which he enjoys as much as I do:




 

Even Amelia got into the cooking act, making some chocolate covered marshmallows. She wasn't thrilled that I was eating one, but I was - it was fantastic. 

With all this eating, I complained: 

  • I: Uggh, I ate too much, I need to go on a diet. Zach, me and you too buddy! 
  • A: Yeah, you sure do!
  • A: I'm so tired of seeing your but cracks every time you turn around

And some cute kids stories: 

While reading story about a mom doing 20 things at a time Amelia said: 

  • A: Wow, that mom is really talented
  • <pause, and head cock> 
  • A: But, not as talented as my Mom.

Amelia hopped into the car angry on the way to school:

  • A: Someone, couldn't hold their horses, and made the hot chocolate for my friends
  • A: And, her name, is Tori Stephens
  • I: It's OK, you can make them something .. like cards
  • A: Dad, no one wants cards, no one.

Zach and I had a setup where he gets paid if he walks me every single weekday (sigh, it didn't last long, will have to try again).  But he missed a day so was like, hymn I missed a day I won't bother till next week. This had me thinking deeply and at my lunch break (also Zach's) I popped up to tell him .. 
  • I: OK, so as a leader your measurement system, really matters, it really affects behavior.
  • Z: Dad, come on, I only get an hour for lunch, I don't want to hear this.
Later at dinner:
  • Z: Oh,my gosh Mom, today dad was telling me how leaders need to use the metric system.
  • I: Not the metric system, metrics, and I explained about how his motivation for walks changed.
  • Z: Oh, I didn't realize, I thought you meant metric and imperial.

We had some un-luckies basement this week.  Thursday all those nice things you flush down the toilet, came out on the floor of the basement to mingle with the carpet.  We got the plumber out, who made flushing safe again, and the house hold was relieved.  (Brief aside, in the before times one would just go to the store/coffee shop to poop, but alas these are not the before times).   Plumber paid, we were drying out, flushing and relatively happy. Then 2 days later same floor, same stuff.  Conveniently the same plumber was on call, and he rinsed and repeated. Here's hoping it sticks, and we're getting our sewer scoped in 2 days as well. 

The bright side, and there is always a bright side,  is we had a glorious trip to the dump.  Goodbye soggy carpet, goodbye beat up coach, good by decomposed bbq, and goodbye multiple broken chairs. Freedom! 


ps. Thank you for asking, I'm very happy with the hot tub. I'm in it most days, and to my amazement I'm all on top of my pool filter and chemical care! Ariba! I really need to get a better picture - next time! 

pss. Amelia is doing so well at reading. We've been grinding every night on her decodable books, for fun we tried reading "Cat on a hat" (one of my favorites), and she was able to easily read all the words except for the few that had digraphs we haven't learned yet in the decodable books. Incredible work Amelia!

entry.title: Family Journal 556AZ: Hot tub xmas tree
entry.content:
I couldn't decide if this was a bucket list or not, but I've always wanted a hot tub, and now I have one! I didn't love Corona Virus, but I am glad it helped me flesh out my backyard with fire pit, canopy and inflatable hot tub. I wish I figured that out back in my 20s!!








Family is doing well, Amelia is now a strong reader. In a strange roll reversal Amelia reads me a bed time story. She complains that when I tell her a bed time story it's always about  a girl named amelia, or a princess named amelia or a prince named Zach.  Super proud of her - what a difference! 


Zach, has a new money making racket - he takes me  for a walk! 7 days in a row and he can cash out 7$

Seattle is back in lock down, so I'm moving my workouts to the basement. It's not nearly as fun, but there as some upsides. There is something glorious about nothing taking any longer then the time allocated to it. And I finally have a use for all my home gym equipment. 







Did I mentioned I decided to die my beard? Didn't work at all, no idea why, but it looked cool when the die was on:

link.title: Family Journal 556AZ: Hot tub xmas tree

entry.title: Family Journal 553AZ: Happy Corona Virus Thanksgiving
entry.content:
It’s thanksgiving, it’s corona virus, it’s a week I got off work, and the kids got off school. Due to corona virus, (and my lack of self discipline) we mostly stayed at home, relaxed and knocked some easy stuff off our collective todo list.  I did get one walk in with both kids in Interlaken which was really nice.

A highlight of course is the great feast!  Before eating ours we went around the table asking what we are grateful for:                                                                     

  • Amelia Grateful to have a nice family. Too bad Baba couldn't be here                                                            
  • Zach Having a wonderful mother, who does some great cooking                                                                     
  • Tori Having a healthy family                                                                                                     
  • Igor Having a wonderful family, and having all the things we need.                                                               




A while back I decided to get Amelia an iPad, and an Apple Pencil. It seemed like a great idea in my head, but then seeing her kind of ignore it, it felt silly. It all paid off the other day though.  I often wake up at 5am and do some writing on my iPad.  Amelia woke up at 5:30, and decided she couldn’t sleep. We thought about what she should do, and she decided to color on her iPad. It was incredible to watch, she’s very detail oriented, and kept zooming in to make sure she could color between the lines. Because she did it digitally, she could print it, which is again - super cool!


Speaking of Amelia, we’re so proud of all the hard work she’s putting into reading and math. It’s not easy for her, but with all the effort, she’s made a tone of progress, and she’s even comfortable reading with me a bit! What a change!!

I often mention how Amelia can’t go 10 minutes with doing a handstand.  This at first is at odds with her desire to vegetate watching TV.  Being creative she found a solution.





At 10, Zach is whicked sharp and knowledgeable, but values his privacy. He doesn’t like having his picture shared, and loves following, and enforcing  He values order.  This puts us at odds as I want to share everything, and rule following is low on my list. 

Zach often won’t share his writing, but this thanksgiving it turned out a game he wanted to play (a WW-II simulation) went on mega sale, and he wanted money to be able to pay for it. He signed up to plant bulbs for Tori and write me a 6 page story to make the money.  The first 3 pages of the story were fantastic, but they became progressively crappier, with mostly large font chapter headings and 1 paragraph chapters.   Upon digging in, turns out he’d started the story, and just stuffed the last few pages.  I’ll ask his permission to share the start of the story, as it’s fantastic! 

At 10, Zach is both super mature, and we can  go for walks and he can really explain stuff to me, which I really enjoy, but he’s also not developed his discipline yet, and needs our help developing the self discipline muscle. He really dislikes it, but he now has to get up by 10am on non-school days, and isn’t allowed to use his computer in bed.    Which, by the way, looks like my bed with a place to sleep and a place for a large stack of electronics. 



At 42, I’m rather proud of myself as well. I spent no more then 20 minutes thinking about work, which is like a record, and I really didn’t need to procrastinate on my time off! I’m at day 40 of my meditation practice and the last 20 days at 20 minutes a day (a personal best). This has a consequence of me not having enough time to myself in the morning, so I chose to start waking up 30 minutes earlier at 4:30 am.  Due to corona virus the gym is closed, and my personal trainer moved to Australia, which makes it hard to motivate physical fitness, but I’ve adapted my gym workout to something I can do at home, and am doing it a few days a week.  With my time off, I got a bunch of time to play with my tech hobby. Playing with tech is definitely a hobby that brings me a lot of pleasure, and might even be helpful for my day job (though probably not). 

For my future self who wants to reminisce: 

  • I FINALLY can use VIM on iPad sufficiently,
  • I FINALLY got true color mosh working, through a custom build on server and client
  • I flattened and spun up a new AWS shell in about 4 hours of work
  • I learned a tone about SSH, and MOSH . 
  • I was able to reverse engineer the Kindle Cloud Reader
  • I update an open source html to markdown library to make book summarization easier.  
  • I used that tech to rapidly summarized eat that frog, which is ironic, as I probably did that to procrastinate.                                                                                                                                                                                    

On the house front, my smart switch failed, and started flashing the lights continuously. This resulted in my having to spend 2 days without upstairs power.  This was a good motivation to kick my but into actions and I finally upgraded our smart home hub, and re wired the bathroom timer to auto shut off! This was made much easier by finally knowing what I’m doing here, and having a power screw driver which makes my life super easy as I’m pretty weak at screwing stuff in. 

Also, on the house front, I went through all clothes and transferred my “Skinny Igor”  clothes to storage till the day I can fit in them so the master bedroom isn’t a mess. Hopefully, it’s clean enough that Tori feels good about being the master bedroom.

Have a great week, and remember - If you spend time cleaning, your wife will have a good feeling! - ZiaT

link.title: Family Journal 553AZ: Happy Corona Virus Thanksgiving

entry.content: This is pretty nice, I like it

entry.title: Family Journal 550.1AZ: Amelia, reading, writing and motivating!
entry.content:
This is a special make up post where I'm adding some extra amelia content!

You can do it meow, meow

Several days a week, I bike Amelia to school in her pod. The pod is up a steep hill so I have bike 4mph up while huffing and puffing.  Every time as I go up the hill Amelia is behind me singing "You can do it, meow, meow, you can do it meow, meow". Which is very motivating. 






One day, Amelia had a spelling test so I sang to her, "You can do it, meow, moew", and she said "Dad, that doesn't work on me". I answered, what do you mean it doesn't work on you? And she said - "Well, dad, I just made that song up so I wouldn't hear you grunting while you're going up the hill". 


Reading  all by herself

Amelia has had to work extra hard to make progress in reading, and frustrating as it can be she just keeps pushing.   I'm doing my part by making sure I'm reading with her, and the other day, she said let me pick a book and lets read it together. This was the first 2 pages she was able to read all by herself!



Why does a 6 year old need an Apple Pencil?

For some reason, I decided Amelia needed to have an apple pencil so she could draw on her iPad. After I got all the kit, I felt a little silly about it, but then Amelia saw me drawing and added this beauty to our shared notes - totally paid off! 


A note to grown up Amelia's 

Amelia maybe one day you'll be reading this when you're older, maybe I won't be around.  And when you read this, remember how much I love you, and how wonderful you've made my life (same goes for Zach -- who is now hopefully also one of your best friends!)

link.title: Family Journal 550.1AZ: Amelia, reading, writing and motivating!

entry.title: Family Journal 550AZ:Halloween 2020, Tori Super party!!!
entry.content:
This year, thanks to the Corona there's no trick or treating, but Tori made up for it by making the worlds greatest halloween party, You can see it if you have permissions here.   A few highlights: 

* Amazing Food
* Pumpkin Scavenger hunt under a blanket of fog
* Some good friends 
* Carnival Games
* Best carved pumpkins
* Live bats

entry.title: Family Journal 549AZ: Good Habits and a sliver of the good life
entry.content:
Saturday we donned our masks and went to a corn maze for Zach's friend's birthday.  It was a crisp day, and we had a nice time.  Getting out is a good habit to get into! 





Zach has been joining me for nightly walks, he's gotten lucky that my leg is a injured so I can't go far, it's very enjoyable for me to get some quality talking time. Amelia likes it too.  Zach doesn't love getting his picture taken, but when he's in VR, he doesn't really know what to be objecting to: 


TODO: Get a photo of Zach in VR. 


Amelia by contrast loves photos and even requests photos. She's enjoying school, and has made some great pictures and stories. Amelia and Igor have even been reading together the last few nights which I'm enjoying and need to make a habit. 




We got Amelia a new Diary, and the first page is adorable: 



Like Zach, Amelia digs the VR too. Vacation simulator is her favorite

Pretty cool Amelia wrote "I love my dad and mom" all by herself, interesting the dog is Kirby, and that's Uncle Ryan going "Uggh" as he takes Kirby up the hill. 


Tori has been working on a halloween production.  We usually go all in on Halloween, but this year it goes up to another level. A few photos: 









As for me,  I've had some very solid habits this week. I've been doing personal training for 90 days now, and other then having a hard time walking due to a pulled muscle I'm feeling incredibly fit (thought still incredibly fat).    I also re-started meditating, always a good thing, and always surprising that I stop, and I started going for nightly walks with Zach and reading to Amelia. Remind me to keep it up!


Have a great week - "Like a toad, see a road, sit on a commode" - ZiaT

link.title: Family Journal 549AZ: Good Habits and a sliver of the good life

entry.title: Family Journal 545AZ: Morning Snuggles
entry.content:
This weekend I've been feeling lazy, and just sitting in the easy chair in the living room the morning. If Amelia sees me in the living room chair, she'll curl up in my lap and snuggle with me.  Today I decided to read some poems with her (I love Shel Silverstein), and to my amazement, she read a few words. After reading poems for a while, she brought out her reading homework, and we did a bit of it. She's gotten much better at reading - the pod is really helping.  What a great thing to savor. 

Last night, Amelia and I watched Mulan, it was eye opening to see how much sexism there is in the world, and it made me really happy when Amelia shouted back at the screen that "girls can be warriors too"! She'll do that alot, talking back to the TV, and reasoning out how other people are feeling and if their behaviors could be framed in a kind light. It's awesome.  

Zach was bugging me the other day about the newly released VR headset, which of course he didn't realize I'd already bought and had on pre-order.  When I told him he jumped up and down with joy we were getting it. Later, I told him "Zach, aren't you glad your dad loves you?", he replied, "No, I'm glad my Dad loves VR".   I corrected myself, OK, I love you and I love VR. 

I had a scary experience the other day. Amelia biked down to the park the other day while I walked, at some point she zigged, and I zagged, and before I knew it I couldn't find Amelia. I looked and looked, and my heart rate picked up, and I tried calling home, but Tori wasn't near her phone. It was a bright sunny day, and my awareness really increased, and I kept seeing people and motion, but no Amelia. I finally decided the bet bet was to go home and grab the car.  Of course, when I returned home, there was Amelia's bike.  I found Amelia, and she'd been crying. I'm pretty sure she was waiting on the corner, and when I never came she got really upset, and finally went home.  Scary experience - but in good news, she knows how to get home on her bike.  

Tori is ramping up for halloween, she's gathering pumpkins and bats and milk jugs, and fog machines. She also made an escape room for the kids last week, and this week she's making escape rooms for the kids and their friends.  

In other news, I used the corona virus as an excuse to get into bad shape, and gained about 20 lbs so I signed up for personal training 6 week ago. While I haven't lost any of that weight, I'm feeling much  stronger, and to my amazement, I was able to touch my toes - which I guess makes sense as I do mobility training.  I also can barely walk from my sore muscles- which I guess makes sense as I do strength training too. 

I got the photos off my camera from when Kai and Ceil came over - It's cool to see the kids hanging out (though we didn't let the grown ups in)






Lastly, turns out Zach's not the only chef in the house - here's my baked potato, roasted garlic, kimchi special:


And Amelia wants in on the action with her killer cucumber, Salami Cracker Combos


Have a great week, and remember - If you want to touch your toes, get your butt off the couch and start stretching!

entry.title: Family Journal 544AZ: Happy Yom Kippur AC
entry.content:
After not seeing our good friends Miga, Brian, Kai and Ceil and they came by and brought us a great joke - we haven't done that since BC.  Before Corona - BC - Get it?

Anywhoo, we haven't seen them since BC, and it was great to catch up. We enjoyed some wonderful sliders that Tori made while roasting marshmallows on the back yard fire pit.

Amelia and I bike to school many days, and it's essential we don't skip when it's raining, otherwise, we'll always skip when it's raining. Friday, it was pouring cats and dogs and Amelia did *NOT* want to bike school. She begged me to take the car, but I made her bike. She was furious, she didn't say anything to me the whole ride, and then refused to give me a hug when I dropped her off. 

Oh, tangent, as part of taking Amelia to school, we go up a giant hill, even with the electric bike, I still only go 5km/h which is basically walking fast, and usually while I do it, Amelia is biking behind me singing a song. 

"You can do it, you can do it, I believe in you, you can do it"


Anyway, Friday, along with the no hug, and the silent treatment, there was no song of encouragement to get up the hill, gotta say, the song helps.

The kids are getting more normal activities, they're back into swimming, and this week they restarted circus. Amelia's now in general circus, and Zach is specializing in the trampoline. 

Big week for Zach in gaming. First, Zach got himself a board game, which unfortunately, his family isn't too excited to play. So we got the much easier Jenga, and Clever Hans (a very fun dice game), so maybe there'll be some board gaming in our household. 

Zach also got excited about writing a game in twine. We spent some time setting up an example for Zach to work with - I haven't seen his game yet, I'm excited to see it. 

And a few more random photos for a bit of a random week:

link.title: Family Journal 544AZ: Happy Yom Kippur AC

entry.title: Family Journal 543AZ: The Rabbi and the really small apartment
entry.content:
Before we begin

 Long ago there lived a woman in a very small house.  At her wits end she went to her Rabbi and said “Rabbi, my house is so small, there’s not enough room for my family”. The Rabbi looked at her thoughtfully and said,  “Not a problem, I know exactly what to do - bring a chicken in your house”. 

 The woman thought the Rabbi was crazy, but did it.  The next week she came back to the Rabbi, and said - “Rabbi, rabbi, this is awful, my house was small, but now with the chicken it’s even smaller”.  The Rabbi responded thoughtfully - “Not a problem, I know exactly what to do - bring your goat into the house”.  The next week, the woman came back to the Rabbi - “Rabbi, you have no idea, I’m going Crazy my house is so small, and with the chicken and the goat, no one can move - you must help me”.  The Rabbi responded “Not a problem, I know exactly what to do - bring your pig into the house”.  The woman couldn’t believe it, but out of respect for the Rabbi she followed his directions.   The next week - she didn’t even want to talk to the Rabbi, but she said - “Rabbi - now you must help me, the house is tiny, no one can move, and it stinks of all the animals”.  This time the Rabbi responded - “Perfect, now take the pig, the goat and the chicken, and put them all outside”.   The next week the woman came back, and said “Rabbi, you are so wise, my house feels huge” 

The past 2 weeks on top of Corona Virus and School starting Seattle has been blanketed in smoke so thick you felt ill when you went out side.  The recommendation was to keep your doors and windows sealed, but our house is old, and a week in my office was getting Smokey.   Any who, finally the smoke has passed, and even though we still have Corona Virus - just being able to go outside and next feel smoke feels fantastic!

Back to our updates

Zach is a tech wizard, an aspiring chef and has a strong desire to help.  At hsome, he often cooks, burgers and pizzas being some of his favorite meals. He also involves Amelia in the eating and cooking process - though on the cooking side, even if his intent is to help include Amelia it often comes across as badgering - maybe he learned that from his Dad.  

On the tech side he’s been deputized the class tech helper, which includes helping the teacher mute and unmute the other kids and also helping with screen shots and answer other technical questions.  This is very impactful as having kids unable to mute themselves is very disruptive. 

Amelia is growing her vocabulary and her personality. Just yesterday when I said we needed to go home she told me “Dad - stop repressing me”. 

Personality wise, the other day on our way to her School (Amelia is in a Pod) Amelia was like: 

  • A: Dad, I was really grumpy yesterday
  • I: Oh - I know. 
  • A: Well, if it happens again you just need to give me a food
  • I: OK.
  • A: Do you know what it is? 
  • I: Milkshakes?
  • A: Nope, Bell peppers, they’re my favorite food, whenever I get them I get to be in a really good mood. 
  • I: Perfect — Sold!
This week, we got 2 of our 3 backyard trees cut down. WOW! There is now so much light in the backyard, it’s amazing (can’t wait to see it without the blanket of smoke and rain). 

Tori, always the Prop Tart (That’s a technical term for her job) has been busy making the kids escape rooms, and trying to master the Halloween Eyeballs (Yummy and Tasty).   Also, always the driving force, she helped me get my Green Card stamp, which unlocks my ability to travel and get a Refi.

link.title: Family Journal 543AZ: The Rabbi and the really small apartment

entry.title: Family Journal 541 AZ: Back to school - Virtual and Physical
entry.content:
Time flies when you’re having fun, and it flies when you’re not, so you’re better off having fun (Easier said then done. 

This summer had glorious weather (over shadowed by Pandemic-I), but all things come to an end and now it’s fall, and the kids are back to school. 



Zach with his strong academics, and computer skills starts school online.  He’s excited to see his friends and start helping out, and to help him along he got a new computer.  Of course, he’s much less interested in using the computer for school, and much more interested in having a computer that can play some serious games. 

Amelia, being younger, and in need of some extra reading help, is in a Learning Pod. A Pod is like a cross between home schooling and private school. It’s homeschool with a small group of kids and a teacher -  This sounds good in theory, but couldn’t be better in practice. 

I’m feeling long winded today, so here’s the origin story.... 

Long ago, I used to have a boss, Ben,  at Microsoft that I really liked, and hung out with, but after leaving the team other then running into each other once every few years we lost touch.  9 years later on Amelia’s third week of Kindergarten Amelia was telling us about her new “Bestie” (Best Friend for old folks) and how much she loved her.   The fourth week of Kindergarten while doing drop off I ran into Ben who told me his daughter was also in the class, and we both talked about how our daughters had found best friends and were really enjoying school.  How cool we were having the same experience! As we talked, we were simultaneously like oh look, our daughters are hugging someone, I wonder if that’s the Bestie, and sure enough, Amelia was hugging Ben’s daughter (Sadie). 

Fast forward a year, mid pandemic, and the kids are going bat shit from being cooped up in the house. After much begging Sadie still the Bestie came over for a sleep over.   Sadie’s mom, Lori (Confusing I know) was organizing a pod, and telling us how it works; 

“Our basement is setup like a little school, and we’re interviewing teachers, and are shooting to get 5 girls for the class”

We’d already been thinking we needed to get extra tutoring for Amelia so were like we’re in!  


OK, back to the present, on the first day of school: 

I start work at 5am, and at 5:15am Amelia is in my office so excited that she can’t sleep.  She’s excited to go back to school and hang out with her best friend. Needing to work, I put Amelia in charge of making some drawings - my favorite of which being me proposing to Tori in a park (not quite how it happened). 

At 8:10, it time to take Amelia to School so I put her on my cargo bike and we biked to school. It’s a perfect ride to school. We go the slightly longer way which lets us go through a Forrest path and up less busy streets. I get a bit of exercise and Amelia and I get to chat while breathing the fresh air!

I’m not going to lie, one of my favorite things to do was walk the kids to school, but even when we were doing school in person, the walk was too short. Getting a short ride is amazing in general, and with the e-bike even more glorious.   

But with the Pandemic, getting to add to that a morning routine where I have to do something everyday at the same time, even a bike commute, is FANTASTIC. My joke, is even if I didn’t do the school pod, I should have paid to get a commute!

link.title: Family Journal 541 AZ: Back to school - Virtual and Physical

entry.title: Achievement Unlocked: Zach the Programmer and Chef
entry.content:
I don't think I've ever felt the over powering pride I imagine grand parents feel when they hold their grand child. Until today.


If you're not me, this post sucks for you to read, but I want every detail so I can savor it forever. There are several events that happened.


  1.  Zach and I learned to Program
  2.  Zach and I wrote a bot
  3.  Zach and I watched a show about programming
  4.  Zach made us burgers for lunch


Programming in Python


Out of the blue, Zach asked me if we could work on twine ( a choose your own adventure builder). Sure I said, maybe this evening. Luckily, instead of forgetting(\*) we did it.

 (Imagine what would have happened if I just zoned out and didn't do the computer time with Zach. I would have missed this life changing opportunity)


  At Dinner Time:


  • Z: Yeah, like maybe we could do the thing with the counting stuff, and stuff on your screen (Kind of hard in twine)
  • Z: So, I was working on this bot, and I found the if tag, and that seems like really important.
  • Z: And I want to do a game like, that you get stuff from the user.
  • I: OMG, yeah, this sounds like doing some python, lets sit down and do it.


  (Luckily Zach had already used VS.Code a bit, and also is a now a fast hunt-and-peck typer)

  •   - I: OK, lets do this (and I setup his computer for python development in VS.Code.)
  •   - I: (Write out a simple hello world, with inputting the name)
  •   - Z: Uh, I want to clear the screen
  •   - I: OK, (I write a clear screen function with For(x in (1, 10) ) print line , and call function).
  •   - Z: Hey it only cleared half the screen
  •   - I: OK, so what you gonna do about it?
  •   - Z: Oh, I know I'll change to For x in 1, 20:
  •   - Z: (Who knows about if) Yeah, so if I do "if" that's good but what if it's the other side. Can I make the other thing happen?
  • I: (JOY IN MY HEART) Yes - you can use else
  • Z: Ohhhhh
  • Z: (When running the program, Zach moves his mouse)
  • I: No, real programmers use the keyboard - (explains C-F5)
  • Z: (Going to the mouse on occasion)
  • I: (Chiding)
  • Z: (Now uses the keyboard instead)

  Zach wants to show me something:

  • Z: Can I show you my atlas tag?
  • Sure - what is that?
  • Z: It's a bot.
  •  I: (The tag is ( if name == "Joe" send admin_1,admin_2,admin_3 "intruder, reply or they will be banned", sleep (600), say "you are banned", kick))
  • I: (WOW - filled with pride.)
  • I What does sleep 600 mean?
  • Well, sleep for 10 minutes, 60 second \* 10 min
  • OK, great lets see how to do that in python (I introduce sleep)
  • Lets do some more programming in Python
  • Z: (Tries stuff, like if and else, and changing print statements)
  • I: OK, we're going for milk shakes
  • Z: What?
  • I: Yeah, your choice

  We go out out to the car, and Zach goes to get into the back seat.

  • I: Nope, today you're in the front seat.
  • Z: (Shocked but happy)
  • I: (During the drive)
  • Z: So yeah, school is boring, but it's fun when you want to do stuff, and you don't notice.
  • Z: I read the docs for by myself, to see what I could do. Cuz if you copy and paste you don't really know what's happening when it doesn't work
  • I: (PRIDE++)
  • I: Wow, you wrote that macro by yourself.
  • Z: Yeah, I spent 30 minutes reading the doc on one side, and trying the bot on the other
  • I: Wow, I'm so proud of you.
  • I: Do you know why I'm so proud of you?
  • Z: Because I can be a programmer, and you can make me do it and I'll make lots of money
  • I: No, thought that's true, I'm proud of you because you wanted to do something, and you figured it all out on your own. And you discovered how fun the power of the computer is.
  • I: Now, if you want to become a programmer, which I recommend, you can, but for me, just like for you, it's really fun and you can just do it.
  • I: Buy the way, you still need to get in shape
  • Z: I know

Making a bot

The next day, Zach and I were hanging out

  • Z: Hey, how hard is it to make a bot in python, like a week?
  • I: Nope like a few hours
  • I: (Here's where it's so cool that I"m really good at computers)
  • Z: OK can we do it?
  • I: Totally, lets go
  • I: (I find a bot library, and need to start figuring out Auth and hosting)
  • Z: Oh, I know how to get the Auth token.
  • Z: I know how to invite it
  • I: (We do it and it works)
  • I: How do you know this?
  • Z: Oh I've setup other bots
  • I: OK, lets do this.
  • I: (We get some easy stuff working)
  • I: (We try to do harder stuff, and need to look at the docs)
  • I: (Reading docs slowly)
  • Z: Hey, it's that.
  • I: Huh - how do you know that?
  • Z: Oh, I use the bot a lot
  • I: Wow.
  • Z: Hey, its that there
  • I: (PRIDE: Zach is reading the docs faster then me, and able to spot what is going on, faster then I can)
  • I: (PRIDE: Zach knows the domain model, and just needs my help to do some translation to words)
  • Z: Lets do this and that
  • I: OK - huh, it's not working
  • Z: (Kind of bummed the program isn't working)
  • I: Oh, let me show you a trick you need a print 1 here to know if your program is running.
  • I: See, these are tricks real programmers do all the time.
  • Z: Hey, what's the error
  • I: (PRIDE I CAN FIX ALL THE ERRORS, SO ZACH CAN WORK ON THE FUN STUFF)
  • Z: OK, my bot is good enough.

Watching a programming You-tuber

Heck, I didn't know these existed

I'm usually anti-TV, which is totally bullshit as I waste a tonne of time on my phone reading Doom Scrolling and watching TikTok. This day I was like

  • I: Zach, lets watch some Youtube together.
  • Z: OK, what do you want to watch.
  • I: I dunno
  • Z: How about a programmer show
  • I: Huh?
  • Z: Oh, this guy makes a game - Minecraft in 24 hours.
  • I: What? Sure.

We start watching the show. I'm super enjoying it as I know exactly what's going and it's fun for me.

  • I: Zach do you like this?
  • Z: Yeah, I watch lots of programming shows
  • Z: See TV isn't dumb.
  • I: OK, you're right this one is good.

As we get into the show I start asking questions (it was my 1:1 day, so I was in a Socratic mode). We paused almost every 30 seconds and discussed concepts

  • YouTube Programmer: Lots of blocks slow, instead of small blocks, make big blocks.
  • I: Hey, why is he doing that?
  • Z: So it won't be laggy
  • I: I mean why would it be less laggy.
  • Z: Well there are less blocks to draw, and each block is laggy.
  • I: (Pride!)
  • I: OK, so how many less blocks, if he's using 10x10 blocks
  • Z: Well, 10x10 is 100 blocks, so he's saving 99 blocks for every big block
  • I: (Pride)

The programmer starts working on infinite terrain generation

  • I: What is that?
  • Z: Well, it's like so you always have more map
  • I: What would happen if he didn't do that.
  • Z: Well, you'd hit a wall at the end
  • I: OK, so he's just erasing newly created terrain when he's leaving. Why?
  • Z: Well, so it doesn't get too big and laggy
  • I: Whats the downside of how he's doing it?
  • Z: Well, if you come back it won't be the same.
  • I: (PRIDE)
  • I: OK, well why didn't he just save it?
  • Z: Well it's a pain in the butt to do. and takes space.
  • I: That's right, the space isn't that important, it's the pain in the butt part. Complexity kills us.

Next we watched a show about monetization. Zach and I discussed In App Purchase for Ad CPM, and then I asked him how the Ad revenue from the game compared to the Ad revenue of the Youtube channel. We talked about novelty effects for games, how they get a burst of usage and drop off.

OMG I AM SO PROUD OF ZACH.

Burgers for lunch

Zach pops shyly into my office.

  • Z: Hey dad you want a burger for lunch?
  • I: Sure
  • Z: Uh, it'll be different.
  • I: What do you mean?
  • Z: Well, it won't be a pre-made burger, I'm making it from meat.
  • I: OK, sounds great.

We eat our burgers and they are delicious. I add Kim-chi to mine.
(At dinner, super cool, Zach wants to try Kim-chi)

Several hours later.

  • Z: Hey dad, did you like your burger?
  • I: OMG, It was awesome.
  • Z: OK, can I have 10$?
  • I: No.
  • Z: 8$?
  • I: No.
  • Z: 4\$
  • I: NO
  • Z: But I made you lunch.
  • I: I made you dinner.
  • Z: But lunch was better.
  • I: Hahahaha, forget it not gonna work.

Pride that he had the gal to push for it, and negotiate down.

link.title: Achievement Unlocked: Zach the Programmer and Chef

entry.title: Family Journal 537 AZ: Island Hopping
entry.content:
Some days you nail it, and yesterday was one of those days.  Sick of being cooped up in the house, I decided we'd go biking on an island. Being the planner I am, I stuck Amelia on my bike and headed to the ferry terminal.  When the ferry guy asked me where I was going, I asked where's the next ferry that's departing going - and off to Bremerton we went!  










The ferry is always glorious, and I set up my camp chairs (which I carry on my bike) on the deck and watched the sun and the waves.   



Bremerton was a ghost town, but we found a nice Mexican place that served mac and cheese tacos for Amelia and Gyro tacos for me - Yum! Given the environment, I settled on a corona. 


Afterwards we biked to a park where Amelia got to play on playground equipment for the first time in years. 

And to finish a perfect day, we stopped and got ice cream. Some how I ended up with a small ice cream, and Amelia got an ice cream bigger than her head, she didn't finish it though. 

In heath news, vacation's over and I've started up with a personal trainer - here's hoping it helps! 

In home news, I realized I'm gonna be working for home for a while, maybe till next summary so I invested in some snacks. 

More importantly, I realized I need to think through how to make a clear distinction between work and home, and "dressing up" for work is a good way to do it.    Of course I'm not gonna wear a suit and tie, so I bought a hat to remind me!

entry.title: Family Journal 535AZ: Summer Days
entry.content:
Ah the middle of summer.  Nothing says summer like some kids playing in a sprinkler on a hot day. Amazingly we were blessed with discovering our neighbor has a kid Amelia's age who's here every other week and loves to play. This lets both of them get a biking buddy, and play buddy. Super nice.


I'm pretty excited to be back in the gym. Since the gym opened 3 weeks back, I've been there 5 days a week as soon as they open, and I'm finally going to bite the bullet and sign up for personal training - super health kick here we come.


Tori continues making our incredible front and back yards, which you can see from the incredible front yard photos above. We constantly get rid of more and more stuff, though we some how don't have any more room.



We also got a super toaster oven. I love it! I've never had this much warm food in my life, I dig it! I've even started making shish-ka-bobs in it.





Amelia really like talking to Baba - and I think they figured out how to make group selfies (which my team also owns):



Speaking of every morning Amelia gives me a morning hug, some days however, she forgets, so she'll sneak into my office (often during a meeting) and give me a hug. I LOVE IT!



She also made me a portrait.  I think she was a bit generous with the hair, but goofy shirt was spot on!




For a reason I'm not quite sure about, I got a milk shake the other day from Tori and the kids. It was delicious.



And not to forget, I have two children!  Speaking of which, Zach is super proud as he's doing in real life training in his video game, and has been promoted to the next rank - super proud of you.



Have a great week!

entry.title: Family Journal 531AZ: Houses and Drunken Bike Batteries
entry.content:
Tori has been making huge progress on the house. She’s built a trellis, stained the glass, and plannted a Unicorn. Tori and I have many differences, but we certainly share what a cool house looks like: 







Back in March Greg, Chris and I got e-bikes. As a result Thursday nights we bike 15 miles (22 km) to a remote location,  do some drinking, and bike home. 





Two Thursday’s ago before heading to our remote location, I saw my battery was half empty so I loaded my other charged battery into my pannier (a special bike bag that clips to my bike rack) and away I went. I figured my battery would die on the way home, but not an issue as I’d just swap batteries. 

That night I might have had a drink too many and was riding home pretty groggy.  About 3 miles (5km) from my house, my battery died, which was not an issue as I planned for this.  So I got off my bike, and went to open my bag and switch batteries.  However, my bag was not on the bike, which meant no battery for me.  I figured oh shit, the bag must have fell off when I went over a big bump on my way from the remote location, and I begrudgingly realized I would need  to back track to find my bag. I knew it could be as far back as 13 miles, which I’d have to ride without battery, already tired and groggy, but once I found it, I could whip home on the battery. 

I hoped I’d just lost the battery, so I wouldn’t have to peddle far. Sadly I did not drop the bag close, and I made it all the way back to the remote location without finding my bag (or my battery). So tired and groggy, after biking 13 miles without battery, I then had to bike the remaining 15 miles home.  

A very late night, and no battery.  I called the remote location the next day, in case I’d left the bag there (unlikely), and they said I hadn’t. That was shitty because the bag and stuff in it cost on the order of 800 bucks, and worse the battery was out of stock.   

Two Thusday’s later I’d given up on every finding my bag, and battery and was ready to spend the 800$ t replace it. Whining about this at the remote location to Greg and Chris, the remote location tender walked over and was like hey, do those bikes have a bag? Yes, I said!!! And he was like, oh, yeah I was heading home two Thursday’s back and found a bag.   Any woo, we gave the remote location tender a 100$ tip, and I’m ecastic!

Like me, Amelia had some good luck too.  Turns out our neighbor has a kid (but partial custody). The neighbor (and kids) are very private, and almost never come out of the house. The other day, there little boy was outside, and Amelia saw him and started talking to him.  Now, she has a BFF who she can visit by walking across the yard. SCORE!!!! Tori also installed some rings for Amelia which she uses to get strong:






Zach is a spitting image of his Dad.  I think this photo captures it well:



It's pretty cool that i get to work on Messenger, which is how we stay connected with Baba!


And if we're doing the run down, we better include the cat, which really enjoys lounging about:



Have a great week - ZiaT!

link.title: Family Journal 531AZ: Houses and Drunken Bike Batteries

entry.title: Family Journal 528AZ: Home Improvement
entry.content:
Amelia is eating our first strawberry of the seasons


Tori got tired of the cats knocking out the WiFi so she helped me ceiling mount the electronics. She also helped me jurry rig a window opener, which is feels very much like something I'd come with myself .

We also installed our projector, which I love. If you're going to sit on your ass doing nothing, you might as well make it an event that means something instead of just zoning out on the phone.


Movies are fun, (go re-watch Rambo) and watching busking and shows is great as well!

Lastly - Circus!

No, lastly, there are no photos of Zach this week, there are also no non-orange popsicles. Coincidence, Causation? Correlation? Perhaps just Crustaceans.

entry.title: Family Journal 527AZ: Riding with Influencers
entry.content:
Today,  was fantastic weather and Amelia and I biked down to the beach (45min away, thank you e-bike!).  On the way, Amelia was telling me about being an influencer, and how she had lots of followers on  Youtube and on Instragram. I told her I only have 3 or 4 followers, and she said that's OK, she'd ask her followers to follow me instead.  



Virtual happy hours are an important part of quarantine, and it's important to be prepared. 



Deserts are a great way to make family time sweater, so after dinner we did a family trip to the grocery store to get some ice cream and brought it home and enjoyed it: 





I'm not the only one who likes the e-bikes. Greg and Chris got them as well, and we've been doing some group rides. Though this ride to drive in mcdonalds, maybe wasn't the healthiest. 


Zach is standing up more and more discord servers. This time, he asked someone a game developer if they wanted a discord server for their game.  The developer said yes, and now there's another discord server under Zach's management. 



Finally I absolutely LOVE this video. It's perfect for the quarantine, but if you pay enough attention, you'll realize it's about life productivity. 



Have a great week, and remember: Deep in spring, goats will sing, and bells go ring - ZiAT

entry.title: Family Journal 526AZ: They Yard
entry.content:
Yards are cool things that don't get nearly enough air time. Tori is building a herb octopus cat scratcher darth vader side of the house, and I'm living large on the other side under the purple canopy.  Expect more front yard adventures soon. 
'

entry.title: Family Journal 525 AZ: Amelia learned to ride her bike
entry.content:
There's something magical about watching a kid learning to bike. First they don't know how, then they do but they're afraid, and then magically, they are riding as if they've been doing it their whole life.

Amelia can now bike on her own! Every day she goes out and rides back and forth back and forth on our strip of side walk (sadly, we're on a hill so around the block is a no-go). 

After a very long time not using my blow torch cooking skills, I grab a hunk of cow, and the blow torch, and made a wonderful dinner. 








It was really hot, so I had a G&T too:

link.title: Family Journal 525 AZ: Amelia learned to ride her bike

entry.title: Family Journal 514 AZ: I have arrived
entry.content:
Most weeks are a blur, but some weeks you take some time to breath, and realize just how amazing your life is.  This is one of those weeks.

First some cute things Amelia moments:


Amelia was interested in birth, and she said. 

“Dad where do babies come from? I understand babies come out of the vagina, that makes sense, but how do they get in there?”

Amelia was curious about Santa Clause: 

“Wait a second. How does Santa get in, we don’t have a chimney?”

“Igor: Ah, he comes in the cat window”

“What? How does that work, Santa is really fat, and the cat window is really small”

While riding my folding bike: 

“Dad, this feels funny”

“Igor: What do you mean”

“My vagina feels funny”

“Igor: Hymn, lets ask your Mom later”.


On a date

Amelia and I went on a date where we had “Amelia Noodles” (Pad Thai), super tasty and Amelia loved them. As we ate there was a couple of students on a date, Amelia looked over puzzled and said: 

“Are those grown ups or teenagers”

When I don’t go to the gym my back tends to hurt ... 

“Dad, did you go the gym? I need you back to feel good so you can play with me”

Every morning when I take her to school

I get a great big hug, and we decide how many, and what kind,  there will be. Usually there’s at least 5, sometimes one handed, sometimes extra big squeezing, and sometimes upside down. It’s wonderful.

Zach has his moments too: 


Zach’s always looking for schemes to make money. For a while he was selling Magic markers:

On his newest type of markers

“These ones are really good, a new brand of secrete markers - Toxic”

On starting school, he had to introduce himself with stuff people don’t know about him, and things that are interesting:

“I was born on the floor of my living room, and my Dad is a magician”

This was so good, I used this when I was introduced at a talk.

Once, one of Zach’s friends mentioned “Porn”, Tori didn’t want to get into it, so here’s what ensued:

“What’s porn?”

“Tori: Oh, porn? Oh, that’s like really big prawns”.

“Really, are you sure?”

“Tori: 100% sure”

Dad had some moments too week too: 

I bought myself some e-bikes, 1 to drive Amelia around, and 1 to drive me around. I also started working on Amelia’s magic show, and I got some powerful new coin magic into my bag of tricks (literally).  Lastly, since my bike is electric, I can get up hills myself, which is great, now I can get to way more coffee shops and the gym without having to drive.

link.title: Family Journal 514 AZ: I have arrived

entry.title: Achievement Unlocked: Resilient and Persevering children.
entry.content:
Amelia, Zach I am so proud of you.  There is nothing in life that is more importance then resilience and perseverance  (maybe discipline) and you two have it in spades.

Zach - You’re a pleasure. You are an entrepreneur and hacker.  You will grind through. You have a web site, a discord server, you are streaming, you have a Patreon account, and are making more money from then from your allowance (technically from your allowance, if you did your chores, which you don’t ).  Through all of this you had to learn, and try, and try again when you failed. When your Dad put off doing things you pushed and pushed (like the domain name, like the certificates, like the patreon account) till you got it done.  This resilience and preservance is what makes you great! 

I am so proud that you persevered to do all of these things.  Showing and telling people all that you’ve done makes me ecstatic.

Zach’s Games: https://zacookiegames.com 





Amelia - You are a pleasure, you’re always willing to try thing, always willing to go roller skating or bike riding, or grinding through gymnastics, and realizing falling down and getting back up is how you grow, and you lean into falling down.  You are an inspiration

I am so proud of us biking around the city, taking you places on the bike makes me ecstatic!

link.title: Achievement Unlocked: Resilient and Persevering children.

entry.title: Family Journal 513: Wheels
entry.content:
Turns out I have a thing for wheels!  But I guess you know that if you know me, or have read my eulogy  This week I got a cargo bike to carry around my most prized possessions - my roller skates.

Kidding! I got the cargo bike to carry my most prized possession - Amelia and Zach. Pictures of the kids on it pending (it's currently really cold).

Speaking of cold, I finally got over my cold, and now take a regiment of nasal sprays, allergy meds and nasal lubricants.  It's strange not have a a back ache every morning from coughing too much (happy 40s!).   Speaking of 40s I've now got some kind of IT band problem, oh well, to quote a friend of mine "You know, your body is like a used car, you just get some duct tape and wrap that back on".


I've got some free time again, so it's time to get back into magic.   I'm learning how to do a kid show. So far I'm in the research phase, but hope to have a 7 and under kids show ready by Amelia's birthday (or atleast her 7th birthday party).

It's been a while since I've been dieting -- definitely time to get that started again.

entry.title: Family Journal 512AZ: Progress
entry.content:
Zach presented McBeth this week. Very impressive.   It reminds me why being a dad is awesome. First I couldn't really see anything, I couldn't really hear anything, and I'm pretty sure I don't understand McBeth, however, when Zach got up there and did his bit, I was filled with pride and joy - wow!!! Zach's role included killing another character called "Young Siward". Zach enjoyed that.




Zach also explained to me how auto-complete works, very impressive, inline.


Lastly, I told Zach "You know how girls like Unicorn coins", and Zach paused, looked me in the eye indignantly  and said "Stereo Typing".  Ha!



Amelia had a cold and was very grump as I took her to school this week. As she grumped, she told me. Dad, I have too much to think about. I've got to think about the garden, and the remodel, and have an imagination, and I have to be really careful not to share my germs with others.  Adorable.

Amelia and I went roller skating this weekend, always pleasant.

entry.title: Family Journal 511AZ: Always follow your dreams
entry.content:
Title picked by Amelia Dvorkin

January was busy and energy draining, and it's finally over!  I now have time to focus on things that nourish my soul. For example - check out my hard hat liner super warm hat:


















And, I do love magic tricks that end with cards on ceilings:


The world isn't all about me though - there's also Amelia who is Awesome






Lastly Zach has been starting a small classroom militia. Here are his rules and sign up sheets:

link.title: Family Journal 511AZ: Always follow your dreams

entry.title: Family Journal 510AZ: Roller Afternoon
entry.content:
This afternoon was very fun, and I really tried to enjoy it.   We went roller skating (which Amelia and I love), and then we had ice cream (which everyone loves), and in the middle we had BBQ (which had a photo of Jesus and Elvis):




Earlier, Amelia was grooming me, it was snowing, and I made balloon hats (though probably not in that order).   Anywho - awesome memories. Have a great week!






I'm still reading? Hard to believe - well, what can I say, I guess, it's been a long month, keep pushing, you're almost done!

entry.title: Family Journal 507: Clowning Around
entry.content:
I'm not sure how it took me 41 years, but I now have my own clown wig! Very busy week, very busy month.

From Amelia: 
Amelia learned about Martin Luther King Junior (That means he shared a name with his dad).  Here's her poem: 

Matin Luther Kind Jr wanted people not to fight, so make his dream come true, and treat others like you want them to try you, and that is the golden rule.

--
Tell me a joke

Once their lived 2 sushis, but one wasn't a sushi, it was a whale so one day the whale said "I'm a real sushi", but the real sushi said "NO, I'm the real sushi". Then they get all fighty "I'm the real sushi", "No, you're the real whale". ... then the whale was like "I'm not a sushi, I'm a whale without the head".

--
What did you learn at school this week? 

This year we're going to present the poem, which my dad already posted, so so look back to the poem.

--
Tell me about gymnastics?
OK - So in my gymnastics, you might hear this if your'e in my class we have a testing week and we have to see how strong we are, so we have to work extra, extra, extra hard. It's very hard, and it stresses me out, so if you're in this class you can ask my dad, Igor, that you are very stressed out for the testing week - Love Amelia

--
Amelia, anything else? 
If you want a flying unicorn as your own pet, then ask Igor, my dad, and you can reply yes or no.  So I hope you like our blog post, men and my dad Igor.

From Zach:
Zach's trying  to earn money by doing anything. I told him he'd get a dollar if he wrote me something. I shared it with my friend Ammon, and he said in that case it must have been worth 3$. Sly little bugger ... 

Once apon a time there was three chicken nuggets, all three nuggets were running from the big bad human. One day they decided to rob a bank, then with that money they each built a house. The first house was made of marble, pretty but not that effective against a R.P.G launcher. The second house was built on mars, which is vulnerable against a giant  space laser. The third house was built out of the space time continuum, do I really need to explain this? After about 27 years the CIA came along and was not very happy about this. First they used a R.P.G launcher to destroy the first house. Next they used a space laser to destroy the second, but then they saw the third house. So they called M.I.6 and the Dr. saved the day. THE END!      


From Igor: 
Did I mention it's been a long week? It has. I also got a mini elliptical machine, pretty fun, and I've been biking, also very fun.  Looking forward to life slowing down in February.

entry.title: Family Journal 506: Unicorns are the best and they care a lot
entry.content:
Amelia is helping me write today's post, and she picked the title. 

Tomorrow I head back to work, the kids head back to school, and Tori gets to regain her sanity. I'm going to have a very busy month, so remind me to take lots of photos, do my good habits, and enjoy the ride!

From Amelia: 

Unicorns are the nicest people on earth and  you should always trust them because they are the magicallist and they can grant your wishes.

My family kind and I love them so much. I hope you enjoy your new years eve.

(Igor: What would you rather have a unicorn or a family?)

A unicorn. I'd definitely rather have a unicorn.

(Igor: Why is that?)

All these years I've been wishing for a unicorn. Everynight I make a wish on my bear, I kiss her, and hug her. In movies they kiss the bear good night and the wish comes true. And nothing happens when I try it. Last night, I did it again, and I had to give up because nothing happened when I did it.

From Zach:

Dad - I setup my own chat server (Discord), I've also erased my old old YouTube channel, and have created a new one, it'll be 24 hours before they enable me to stream, but I'll get there.  My Kindle Fire doesn't support streaming, so can I just use your phone to play games on and stream?

(Igor: Uh, No)

From the cats:

Thank you Tori for the wonderful new flower pot watering device. We love it. Were also getting a bit heavy for our window sill seats - In fact, last night we were all sitting on it and it broke - please fix!

(Igor: I wish I was treated as well as the cats)

From Igor's Scale:

Long time no see, but glad to have you back - you've got a ways to go, but we're old friends, lets get together every morning!

(Igor: It's time for my next health kick - hopefully it sticks)

link.title: Family Journal 506: Unicorns are the best and they care a lot

entry.title: Happy Jump in the lake day 2020
entry.content:
Welcome to 2020! As usual, it’s jump in the lake day!! This is the day we celebrate saying F#\$ You to the resistance. The resistance lies, telling us things are hard, when they are not. The resistance adds suffering, when there is minimal pain - and  that confuses us into not doing the things which give us the most value, joy, and positive identity.

This year, Ryan, Rupali and Kirby joined us, which is always a treat.


ps. Note picture of Zach and Amelia on the airplane - it's slightly doctored as Zach is behind and pushing, but I think I got the same picture several years back.

link.title: Happy Jump in the lake day 2020

entry.title: Family Journal 505: Merry XMas VR Edition
entry.content:
Lots of sick grown ups and sick little people this holidays so a bit of a low energy xmas.  Also, way behind on my blog posts so it'll be a clearinghouse of post-porrui.






Dave went on vacation and loaned us his VR headset.  I can say 1) super fun 2) do not do VR boxing near your TV.

Zach:
Zach said he didn't want to take part in this so he is moving to Pluto. Where his dad can't annoy him. Goodbye. 

Zach has been playing non-stop GoO (Gods of Olympus) on his new 10" Kindle. As his father, it was probably inappropriate to buy him more electronics, but you know, maybe he'll grow up and be a computer junkie like his dad.  Zach is a General in GoO, which is the second top ranked member of the alliance, other then the leader, who there is only one of.  GoO gets pretty complicated, except for the fact that Zach likes to use his "general" powers to dole out punishment. He really enjoys that, law and order are definitely things Zach will enjoy in the future.

Magic:
I've been a little light on the magic of late, but have started working on having spectators cards on to high wall or ceiling.  Tori currently classifies such acts as littering, and will attempt to use her children to remove evidence of said magic.   Luckily, the first rule of card on ceiling or high wall, is it's gotta be really high up :)

Amelia:

Amelia wanted to make TikToks, which is super important because otherwise I'll just spend my time consuming TikTok like an addict. When Amelia gets me to make TikToks then I'm producing useful content.

Amelia likes "doubling" on the uber jump bikes. Incredibly adorable, I need to get a picture.

Amelia Lines:

After playing VR for the evening: 

A: Dad - tomorrow it's my turn to go first at VR.
I: Sure, we can do that but why?
A: Two reasons 1) Zach got to go first today 2) I'll be less whiney.

When I got home from work: 

A: Dad - thanks for lying to me  
I: Huh?
A: When we walked to school this morning and I tripped, you said I was fine, but i had a cut on my knee.

Amelia was playing with her dolls on the counter:

I: What game your playing?
A: Ricky-Ticky-Love-Triangle.
I: What is that??!?
A: Well, Sarah like Ken, but Ken likes Barbies, so you know it' s a triangle.
I: Ohhh, I see.

link.title: Family Journal 505: Merry XMas VR Edition

entry.title: Family Journal 503: Great Wolf Lodge
entry.content:
Great wolf lodge is this really cool water park resort an hour and a half south of us. We went for  a day and spent a bunch of time in the pool! Zach kept doing the big water slide and wanted me to go, but I was a bit afraid.  I really enjoyed the wave pool, I've never been in one before. Trust be told, this was the first time I'd even done a small water slide ant it was kind of scary.  Kai, Ciel and Brian joined us. Sadly, they didn't Miga was sick, so she couldn't come. It was super fun.

Tori and I werea bit under the weather, looking forward to our next trip there!

entry.title: Week 499AZ: Fanny Pack Perfection
entry.content:
Usually I give the microphone to the family, but today lets talk about me. I've been on the hunt for the perfect fanny pack. Tori is going insane as I've purchased over 10 (maybe even 15) fanny packs. It's been a tough journey, I've often thought I had the perfect fanny pack, but then the quality would be bad, or the material would rip, or the pockets would be wrong. But, now I think I have a great fanny pack, except for the color. Tori tells me if I don't buy another fanny pack for 3 weeks, she'll help me decorate this one! Fingers crossed.

Also, I've restarted my meditation habit, I'm at the 10 day mark, which is more then half way to having a new habit, and yesterday, I had a mentoring session with one of my mentee's while walking to the coffee shop up a giant hill @ 5:30 in the morning.  It's been a few good days.


First some sad news. Charcoal, our black cat got run over by a car. That was super sad, but luckily the neighbor cats have moved in, and they seem to like our home more then their home. They're a bit rambunctious, OK, maybe a lot rambunctious, but hey it's like a sitcom where the neighbors come over.  It's also a touch confusing as the neighbor cats look exactly the same as charcoal and mercury.


In happy news Amelia has gotten good at many things.  For example, here's a card she made for her Kindergarten teacher (which she narrated).

I love you Mrs. Yorde, 

Last night i spent a lot of time working on my school work. I saw a unicorn pony while thinking of homework, so I made you this card. I would love if you could stay the whole time I'm in school, but I know I'll need to move on to the next grade. My picture is me dressed like a bat doing my homework in my shadow glass house - Love Amelia. 




She's also great at a bunch of stuff like:


  • Coloring within the lines. Check out her photo, it's amazing. 
  • Hanging out with friends. Check out her hanging with Ciel 
  • Taking care of herself. Check out the photo I found of her when I'd been working downstairs, I came up and she was huddled in the corner watching her Kindle eating ice cream.  Independence, and it's what I'd be doing but not till I got much older. 








Have a great week and remember - Were your fanny pack, folks might think you a quack. But it's OK, they can bray, while you enjoy your day   - ZiaT

entry.title: Week 497 AZ: Happy Halloween
entry.content:
We were Lamas for Halloween this year, which is always fun. Zach would not be a lama, but he looked great in his costume too.

Amelia wanted to go to "Treat Street" a neighborhood that looks cool and is jam packed. Zach realized it was a bad deal. Better to hang out where there are less people and more candy was Zach's optimization point. This was the year Zach and Amelia went to the door by themselves, and I just stood at the side walk waving politely to the parents.  Kids grow up, parents grow up. Check.

The neighbor cats come in our home and lick our dishes. That's not accurate, they lick everything.  It's a bit odd, but I figure we already have taxoplasmosis so it's OK.

Zach's done with his braces! Although he still doesn't smile, he just complains about it less.

Amelia Stories: 
--

Amelia: Dad - I'd like to share ice cream with you but I'm coming down with a cold so, you know.

--

Amelia: Dad if you don't leave right now, I"m going to kill you.
Igor; What? If I die, who's going to walk you to school?
Amelia: Mom or Zach

---



Oh yeah, and I did some meditation for the first time years! Felt great. Here's hoping it's the start of a new habit.

entry.title: Week 496AZ: Busy
entry.content:
This week has been busy at work.  Really busy, but you know the good thing about being busy? Busy people get stuff done. For example, I dressed up in a lama suit and took Amelia to sushi.  At sushi she used chop sticks (super cool).  I also rode her on an electric bike while wearing a lama suit which got many smiles and waves of appreciation. I think screaming like we were on a roller coaster helped too.  Did I mention I got a super cool jacket, and the neighbor kittens come into our home and lick our plates? Yeah, they do.


Amelia belted out some cute lines this week. Some of my favorites;

- So dad likes to keep everything forever, Mom likes throw everything away, I'm with Dad.

- Uh, where do babies come from? I know they live in the belly, and I know how they come out, but what makes them alive? Where does that happen?

Zach is so creative. He built a really interesting world in Minecraft that you travel through in a mine cart that goes up down and around and underwater. The world started with Zach's penthouse, which is a very cool apartment with solar panels and a balcony.  When I ask Zach if he'd make me a penthouse, he made me one as well, but it was made of lots of cake. He told me my penthouse was mostly cake storage.   Odd, but good.


As part of my magic, I've been giving away unicorn coins. It's a great souvenir, but I can make it so much stronger if I build a story around it. The first "story" is these are the coins they use in unicorn land and this is the first unicorn on the head of the coin, just like we have presidents.    That's a good start, I think the final story will include the girl willing the coin into existence or some such - looking forward to it!

entry.title: Week 495AZ: Collected Wisdom
entry.content:
Life gets busy, and it's so easy to forget to smell (and record) the roses.  First some pictures, then some very adorable conversations:


With Amelia:

I've had to leave early of late and haven't been able to walk Amelia to school in the morning so I left here a letter explaining that with a picture of us.  I told her about the piece of paper and she said

"Dad, you know I can't read. But you can put it in my backpack, and if I get lonely or miss you, I"ll have some read it to me".

That made my heart melt. Of course I said.  A few weeks later Amelia said:

"Dad, I was lonely the other day, and tried to find your love letter, but i couldn't find it in my bag". 

Again, my heart melted.  I offered to help her look for the "love letter", and when I found it she gave me a hug hug.

Melted. Heart. Period.

With Zach:

On Zach's first day of school they asked him for two things that were interesting about him. He answered I was born on the living room floor, and my dad is a magician.

I was giving a talk and needed a few lines for an intro. They asked me for two interesting things about me and I said "Well, both my kids were born on the living room floor, and I'm a magician".  Haha.

This weekend we got to see Black Beauty, which is a great story, and an awesome puppet show.  Best of all, Tori's friend Bunny was working the show, so we got to go back stage and see the set. It was AWESOME!!

Have a great week, and remember - If you see plays with horses, then you'll have no remorses - ZiaT

entry.title: Achievement Unlocked: Lemonade Stand
entry.content:
The lemonade stand - the first right of passage for the young entrepreneur.

After weeks of nagging Tori and I to run a lemonade stand, Baba came to the rescue and helped Zach run his first lemonade stand.  It turned into a family affair with Baba conscripted as chef, Amelia as salesperson and Dad as driver.




Not only did Zach make a profit, but he shared his bounty with his employees by buying them milk and cookies.

entry.title: Week 490AZ: Shotguns and school starting
entry.content:
Ten minutes after Amelia was born I took her onto the balcony and rocked her. In a flash of insight, my mind was flooded with her future. First Boyfriend,  Graduation, Marriage, Kids . I vividly remember thinking I'd need to buy a shot gun to shoot the boys that would inevitably come into her future.

Today at the tender age of 5 Amelia mentioned a boy had a crush on her.

I: What's his name?
A: I don't know.
I: Tell me about the boy who had the crush on you,
A:  Oh he wasn't at Kindergarten, he was at wilderness awareness
I: How do you know he had a crush
A: Because he sat next to me the whole morning
I: Did he say anything
A: No, he was too in love with me to talk
I: How do you know he was in love.
A: I told you, he sat next to me, he always played with me. He said he was in love with me under his breath and I can hear it.

This week Amelia started kindergarten , and she enjoys it.  Luckily for us, last week Zach started school and we found out Amelia wasn't registered for school. Tori was able to fix it by standing in line for 20 hours - thank gosh! On Amelia ...



On Zach ..


On me - I've almost re-established my gym habit, 18 days in a row. One of my "motivations" is watching TikTok, which is the social platform for 12 year olds. The target market, the 12 year olds, mocks the old people, but it's  a great platform. Positive, fun and encouraging, my new favorite time to waste time. It's also great cuz I can create TikToks too - 15 second clips, often set to music. I've found a rubber band magician on TikTok, and it's helping my magic.

Speaking of magic, my technique continues to improve, and I'm ready to start integrating bands into my "bar" repertoire.   I'm so lucky I have the coolest hobby ever. It's got depth, easy to do anywhere, and a great way to build social connection.

entry.title: Achievement Unlocked: First Concert - Weird Al
entry.content:
Zach and I saw Weird Al at the Paramount!

There comes a point when you stop doing things with your kids because they want to do it, and start doing it because you want to do it. This weekend, it was the latter! Zach and I saw Weird Al which was super fun.   Kudos to Tori for finding out the show was in town and suggesting we go for it!

Before the show Zach and I went out for a dinner date, and I dressed up in my best clothing.    

We got to sit in the super high seats which was pretty fun, 

Weird Al is an inspiration, he’s someone that does what he wants, has fun, is prolific, and is still going at 60 (yes he’s 60).  Doing what you want means you need to work damn hard, and I bet that guys brutal disciplined while enjoying his life.

In Zach's world:
Last night me and my dad   [Him]  saw weird all Yankovic's live show and it was awesome.  Sadly It ended at 10:30ish so I was tired.  My favorite song was Harvey the Hamster,  but in the top row you felt like you were gonna fall and die.   But death is not fun.   He sang songs like dare to be stupid, Jackson park express and Jurassic park.

Before we went to the show, we took an uber to a cafe called "Yummy Cafe, but it in my mind it wasn't very Yummy. Worst of all, they crammed all the food on a small plate, so when you tried to use your spoon to take food, the other side of the food fell off the plate.  I think it deserves to be called the "Ooh, yucky cafe". 

When dad does magic he blows up the planet and makes everyone embarrassed that they have to be in the same galaxy as them.  That's why they're doing a mars project - so we can send him away and not have to deal with him.

#lifelessonswithzach
#themoreyouknow
#zach_only_wrote_the_first_paragraph_I_had_to_type_the rest.

link.title: Achievement Unlocked: First Concert - Weird Al

entry.title: Week 485AZ: Week of wonders and lighting stuff on fire
entry.content:
Wow this blog post needs lots of love, but who doesn't lets get back on the cadence next week. 

It's been a busy week. I have not been lighting stuff on fire, except my free time. My free time has spend on my intern talk - what I wish I knew when I was 22, and I really enjoyed presenting it. 
I also got into fanny packs, and after a few weeks have  a giant one.  As part of preparing my talk, I realized how important it is to have fun, so I started taking selfies. It's a fun habit and I'm working on it. 

As usual, I've got a few magic tricks I'm working on - but let me tell you about the one I'm most proud of.  For my first intern, I ask him to select a card, sign it,  stick it back in the deck, and imagine it turning upside down. The intern holds the deck in his hands imagines, and it happens. For the second intern I provide the same instructions but this time, the card seems to be lost. We try to figure out where the card went, and it seems the intern's mind had wandered as the card found its way into the waitresses chest pocket. Ah, to be 22 again! 


 Tori is busy with plays. Her one play is closing, and her other is opening so she's beat. On the bright side, soon she'll be done and have some time to herself.

This week in Zach's world: On Monday I started forensic files camp and on Tuesday I set stuff on fire lots and lots of stuff was set on fire. Mostly fabric, someone set the floor on fire, but then they stomped on it so it wouldn't spread - you know someone burned themselves, a good day in camp.

Skipping Wed, we can do that in a bit.

On Thursday we played with electricity with a guy named Kevin. Some of us got shocked, others had hair standing up like Einstiens - oh yeah, everyone but me, cuz you know, cuz I didn't think I'd like getting shocked. 

Backing up the Train, or Wed we went over to the other camp (Camp Imaginopoloutous) and we interviewed them about Brandon, how he disappeared and we thought it was a kidnapping, we thought it was brandon, but we needed more evidence.

On Friday we went to the court and we accused Brandon, but the jury wasn't interested and in the end things happened, people yelled at each other, people where accusing each other about miranda rights, so you know that was my week.


Zach's writing this so he can get some video games, it's a bearable trade, next time he'll need to submit a few paragraphs before the post.

Amelia was at Smartest Artists, I should see if we got any art back!   Amelia says she made 1 best friend and she won the throphy.

We also went for a bike ride which I always love - but it starting pouring, so we had Tori pick us up.



Have a great week and remember - I wish I was 22, and so might you - ZiaT.

link.title: Week 485AZ: Week of wonders and lighting stuff on fire

entry.title: Week 479AZ: Zach to Work (and Amelia)
entry.content:
This week was bring your kids to work week.  Zach came, and looked all grown up: 


There was a Microsoft reunion on Friday, and it was awesome to see everyone that I started my career with. Foolishly, I brought no pictures.  Thank fully, I've been taking lots of family pictures, and that's great cuz I don't have much else to say: 
 


Actually, I have something to say about Amelia. I wasn't paying attention and Amelia started saying in a deep voice "I'm Igor", when I looked up she had on my hat and my glasses. She's adorable. Also, today she was able to ride her bike on her own for a few seconds!



I guess I have something to say about Zach too.  He's great. He made an incredible story about roller skating, that inspired me to keep pushing him to do stuff even if he whines, cuz often he enjoys it!

Also, I was excited to play video games with Zach so I bought a go carting game. Zach was like "What? Go Carting? I'm playing real time strategy games where I need to overthrow governments and fight corruption, and you want to waste my time go karting? Sheesh"!!



Have a great week, and remember - Nobody has any control in this newspaper because it's secretly owned by Zach's illuminatii  - ZiaT

entry.title: Week 478AZ: Biking in Bandon with the Stephens
entry.content:
I'm building a new habit - taking family selfies!!! If it starts to taper off, kick me as it's easy and the memories it captures will be my most cherished possessions! 

This week was a Stephen's family reunion, and we joined them in Bandon Oregon.  Bandon is on the pacific ocean, has fantastic views, and very friendly people.





I brought the "bikes" with us, and now bikes is my bike, Zach's bike **and** Amelia's bike.



Amelia still rides on my bike, but soon she'll out grow that and be on her own bike.   It took us several days to get on our bikes, but we finally started biking!!! Friday Zach, Amelia and I biked downtown. That was a short trip so afterwards  Amelia and I biked to the bar and had a well deserved beer.



Best of all, Saturday  morning I woke up at 5, Zach woke at 6, and at 8 we hopped on our bikes and headed to the coffee shop where Zach's drawing on my iPad, and I'm writing this post.



I didn't have enough vacation time, so I had to work during the vacation.  To make working work, I started work everyday at 6am, worked non-stop,  and stopped religiously at 12pm.   The WiFi at our vacation home was awful, so I had to check out all the coffee shops in town till I found the one with the best WiFi.  While the coffee shop had great WiFi (and coffee), it was too loud for meetings (which is basically what I do for a living), so I needed to get creative.  I wandered outside seeing how far the coffee shops WiFi would go. Sadly, only the parking spot directly in front of the coffee shop (and no others)  which always occupied.  To solve this potential problem  I'd sit outside the coffee shop, watching like a vulture until the prime parking spot freed up, then race to my car and nab the spot.  After that, I'd have meetings in the car, and between meeting run to the coffee shop to recharge my electronics with electricity and myself with coffee.



I've been getting back to my best, waking up early,  writing in my journal, doing magic and restarting my meditation practice.  Up next will be my exercise and diet habits, as I've gotten rather round and soft.  Luckily I've got lots of experience getting back in shape, and I'm ready to eat less, exercise more, and get healthy!

Zach is growing up. For the first time ever, I asked if he wanted to sleep with me, and he said no, I'll sleep on the futon (the next night he did sleep with me).  I'll be honest that made me tear up. Zach's growing up, and soon we'll hit the day where he won't want snuggles (from me).   Even though it's sad, as Tori's wise aunt said, better that then he never grows up.

Zach has also been building his enterainer muscle as well. Friday night he organized a family game night. There was monopoly, exploding kittens and popsicles for all!



Like Zach, Amelia is a smart cookie. She had some great insights this week:

While biking: 
A: Dad, you know what's good about biking?
I: What?
