A: That you can see what's going on.

While snuggling in bed: 
A: Dad, I like camping.
I: My too. Why do like about camping?
A: Well, we don't have electronics so we have to do fun stuff.

While biking
A: Dad, stop interrupting my singing
A:

link.title: Week 478AZ: Biking in Bandon with the Stephens

entry.title: Week 474AZ: Lunch on Zach at Folk Life
entry.content:
This weekend is memorial day, and in Seattle that means a huge free festival at the space needle called Folk Life. The third graders at Zach's school went to the first day of Folk Life on Friday and put on a concert.  I got to come with them (but did have to leave early).  There was a bit of drama because the class was going to sing "This land is my land" and "roll on Columbia", but at the 11th hour they discovered it wasn't nice to the Indians, so they had to cut out those songs.


I also got a rare picture of Zach and Charlie, his best friend at school:

Every year I want to go to folk life, but I've never gone, this year having been inspired by Zach's concert earlier in the weekend, I decided to go!   Zach was very excited, and even offered to buy lunch using his own money - I'm all for free - so we hopped onto the subway and off we went!  For lunch, Zach bought us all a deep fried peanut butter and jelly sandwich. 



It was really tasty, and Amelia also wanted a balloon - so Zach used his awesome big brother skills, and a dollar, and got her a balloon:


It was a very cheap day because there was an insurance company giving out sun glasses and stuffed animals if you'd give them your phone numbers (so I did):



After all the excitement, we stopped at a park, where Amelia hung out


Then we got home, and Zach traced out the millennium falcon (I'm guessing he was trying to trade for some computer time)



Have a great week and remember - If you eat a free PB&J, your hair might go stray, and if you're old go gray - ZiaT

link.title: Week 474AZ: Lunch on Zach at Folk Life

entry.title: Week 470AZ: I'm one hand big
entry.content:
Another year - Amelia's turned 5 and Zach 9.   It happens to everyone (with kids) your kids grow up. One day you look at them and you're like Wow - Zach's almost as tall as Tori, Amelia's doing the monkey bars, I've got streaks of grey in my beard (and my hair, that disappeared long ago).

And you know what, that's what life's all about - and it's awesome!!!


When you ask Amelia how old she is, she holds up her right  hand, spreads her fingers and says "I'm one hand big!"

This year, we aged out of combined birthday parties, so Zach had a Pizza/Video Game/Sushi party, and Amelia had a mock sleep over.  Zach's party is what you'd expect a bunch of kids eating pizza, whacking each other and playing Xbox.  The mock sleep over was a genius move by Tori! The kids loved it, the parents loved it, Amelia loved it, and it was adorable.  The way it worked was parents brought their kids over, they had mac and cheese, and then got into their PJs, did a disco dance party (of course Tori got us disco lights, not to be confused with our black light setup), and watched  a movie snuggled up in sleeping bags. At 7:30 PM, parents showed up rescuing their kids from the fear of a real sleep over.   Let me repeat the words that come to mind for this 1) Brilliant 2) Adorable.

Have a great week - and remember - Happy birthday to you. Happy birthday to you, happy birthday my awesome Amelia And Zach - Happy Birthday to you - ZiaT!!

entry.title: Week 469AZ: Special Zach Edition
entry.content:
Amelia and Zach are both awesome kids. This week Zach's done some extra fun stuff some I'm gonna do a special edition. 


Saturday, I went upstairs for an hour, came downstairs, and was blown away, Zach had done a full page expose. I asked him on what and he said it's on his video game, and he was doing a walk through. AMAZING! I ran to tell Tori how incredible it was that Zach had done that, and Tori was like "Oh -- he's procrastinating, he's supposed to be doing his science fair project"


Tuesday Nights, Zach and I had a curious conversation:

Z: Dad, when do you go to work?

I: Five o'clock
Z: Uhm, well wake me up at 4:30
I: Huh? Why?
Z: Cuz I want to make you lunch.
I: Huh? Why not make it tonight before you go to bed?
Z: I want it to be fresh.

Sure enough Zach got up with me (OK, I did sleep in till 6am) and he made me lunch. Smoked salmon bagel, gold fish, and some pickles - it was the tasty lunch I've had in a while, and it'll probably be one of my favorite.



Have a great week - and remember - Zach and Amelia -- you're the best, I am incredibly, indubitably blessed - ZiaT!!

entry.title: Week 468AZ: Vacation at Legoland!
entry.content:
We went to Lego Land!  Tori set it up so we'd stay in the Lego Land hotel - which was incredible, we were able to go to the park, take a nap in the middle of our park day, and head back into the park all rested up.    The kids loved it. Amelia was so excited she actually woke up early and got me out of bed to tell me how excited she was! Her excitement was contagious and we had a fantastic time.

Not only did we go to Lego Land but we also got to see  Tori's friend's son's bar mitzvah - which was pretty cool.  Their reform synagogue still used Hebrew prayers, but their cantor played the guitar and they had a piano accompaniment.   The service was really lively, and it was like going to a fun folk concert - I really, really enjoyed it. Made me want to go to synagogue again (but as Tori notes, we'd never actually do that).   Zach and I dressed up for the Bar Mitzvah, see our matching bow ties.

Amelia is adorable as usual. At the hotel, Amelia came to me and said - well if you and Mom get scared you can always come get to my bed to get a snuggle.

Zach is sharp as usual.  At the hotel they have breakfast included, and you line up outside to get in for breakfast (instead of coming in the front).  I asked Zach why he thought that was and he answered, well since everyone gets a free breakfast, there are lots of people, and there ends up being a line, and there isn't enough room for a long line in the hallways so they make them stand outside instead. Pretty smart kid.  Zach also got a notebook, and used it to make cool drawings. Many of his drawings reminded of video games, where you could get various tiers of stuff. For example - "simple wood gate", "intermediate metal gate", "super gate". The super gate with 5 turrets, and up to 5 snipers. Very impressive.  Zach even got me on a roller coaster a few times. I can't say I enjoyed it. But I enjoy Zach, and that was worth it.


Charcoal, our new cat, was lonely while we were out. He went out the cat window (which he knows how to get back into) and stood on all our neighbors porches yollowing. The neighborhood forums were filled with concerned people wondering who this collarless cat was. Luckily our next door neighbor realized it was our cat, and we remotely unlocked our door so they could stuff Charcoal back into our house. Of course, he just went back out the cat window to repeat the same exercise. Good news - Charcoal now has a cat collar.

One thing I really enjoyed about Legoland is how well they were setup to make moments. An awesome example is the elevators. The elevators all had disco balls, and when the doors closed, the disco ball would go off, and popular dancing music would play (Staying Alive,  Dancing Queen, etc), I've never danced so much in my life. Other moments were the kids night club, having Legoland characters everywhere, and giving kids birthday buttons so everyone at the park could say happy birthday, and give out gifts like ice cream - impressive and inspirational.

Lego land is in San Diego, so we got a bit of time to hit the ocean beach, which looked exactly like the beaches of Baywatch (old tv series) - except no one was in bikinis, in fact, almost no one was there but us since it was a reasonably cool weekday.   San Diego is home to Balboa Park - which we got a few hours to see and watched an incredible busking act  there - Amelia, watching from my shoulders, loved it.

A few weeks back I got into Pokeman Go, a phone game, which I planned on playing with the kids. As luck would have it, kids couldn't care less, and I got addicted.  On my first day at Lego land I realized how much of my time I was wasting on that game and uninstalled it - hooray for me!!

Have a great week - and remember - thank you Tori, you are an incredible mother, a fine wife, and you make our life fantastic!!

entry.title: Week 467AZ: Pierced Ears
entry.content:
Usually, I'm the first to get up, and Amelia's the last. This Saturday morning, I was reading upstairs and I heard the patter of Amelia feet.  She cautiously poked her head upstairs. I said "Amelia, how come you're awake?" and she ran up and answered "I'm so excited I can't sleep - I'm getting my ears pierced". 

Amelia has been talking about getting her ears pierced for a few weeks now and today was the big day.   We took her to the ear piercing place, and she was so brave, she didn't even cry.    As part of getting her ears pierced she also got a make up kit, and when we got home we worked together to put on her make up.  She is an incredible little girl.
Later Saturday we biked downtown and did some busking, but I'll call that an "unlocked achievement" and put that in another blog post.

Sunday, as embarrassed as I should be to say it,
Zach and I spent the morning playing XBox. First we watched some magic videos, then we played in his minecraft world, and then we tried a bunch of the new video games we downloaded. We might not get an award for productivity, but we get a certificate of father and son fun.

Sunday afternoon, Amelia is at a birthday party, and Zach and I are sitting beside each other on our laptops drinking beer. Well, Zach's using Tori's laptop, and I"m drinking the beer (and Tori is driving). 

In house news - we have a house number! It's pretty sweet, but we still need to figure out how to light it.

Have a great week and remember - Drink with your son; it's pretty fun - ZiaT

entry.title: Achievement Unlocked: Busking at pike place
entry.content:
I don't have a bucket list, but if I did, you know what would be on it?  Performing magic (busking) at the top tourist attraction in Seattle - Pike Place Market.

As if that's not a big enough accomplishment, that got combined with riding Amelia on my folding bike to the pike place market, and bringing home flowers for Tori.

Holy Shit - doesn't get better than that.   A huge thank you for my good friend Clive who let me use his magic setup.

link.title: Achievement Unlocked: Busking at pike place

entry.title: Week 462AZ: Too much Magic
entry.content:
Perfect weather this weekend, and we got out to enjoy it. We  hit a few parks, and got down to the beach, and even brought out the blow torch to finish off some Souse Vide steak!  My highlight for the week was Amelia's stories. 
In Amelia's own words: 
A: I have a boyfriend? 
I: You do? 
A: Yup, me and Tara have a boyfriend. We're going to marry him.
I: Oh, OK. What's his name? 
A: I don't know, I"ll ask him next week. 

---
A: Dad, stop. no more magic shows! 
I: What? Why? 
A: Because that's all you do, you don't spend time with us. 
I:  


In Zach's own words: 

On Sunday I had a playdate with a long lost friend (because we haven't seen them in a long long time, I don't remember the last time, which is really sad).  We left about 5, and we watched hotel Transylvania 3.  We played for a while .... I mean that's really all we did. [Igor here: I force Zach to share stories, sometimes he's not really into it. He's describing our visit Shayna and Allison, who were in our birthing class and are great peoples]



ps. Turns out when he tries hard, Zach can have neat hand writing. Check out Zach's writing above.

Have a great week and remember -Too much magic, could be tragic. Fear not, probably just melodramatic  - ZiaT

entry.title: Week 461AZ: First bike to work of the year.
entry.content:
Technically I biked the Monday after this week, I biked from work (instead of to work), and I decided last year I'm better off taking the time I spend biking to work and going to the gym instead.   But in practice, I'd skipped the gym, it was a sunny day, and I felt like a bike ride - and it felt great!

Anywho, I'm not sure why, but I love pictures where the younger kid is in the shopping cart and the older kid is pushing. I also like photos of the kids hopping, playing with slime and eating desserts.   This works well, as the kids have been doing all of these things in the last week!

Amelia is learning to write her name, and you can see what a good job she did (I wrote the top one, she the bottom).

In Amelia's own words. 

I: What did you do last week?
A: I went to the bouncy place, I got ice cream, then I made slime with Zachy, then I went grocery shopping, and I was angry at You Daddy. Then you died.
I: What??
A: The X said that. (I have no idea what she was  saying, so wrote X) 
I: What?
A: You know the X, it gives me a piece of paper that says what to say the next day.
A: And I got a piece of paper that said Daddy died.
I: What is that thing?
A: I'm not lying. It's the mystery texter
I: What is the mystery texter?
A: I can't tell you. He'd lock me in jail.
I: No, no one will lock you in jail, ever, I'll never let that happen.
A: Just kidding, it's just a joke.
A: Daddy, it's just a joke.

I: Why were you mad at me at the grocery store?
A: Because 1) I didn't get any treats I wanted. I just wanted the mystery flavored one, but then I got the one Zachie wanted because I didn't want him to get angry at me. And I didn't get a balloon, and I didn't get anything else I wanted.

In Zach's own words. 

I: What did you do last week?
Z: I watched TV, I went to Arena sports, and I had 2 sleep overs
Z: Can I go now?
I: No.
Z: Nothing.
I: uuuuhhhhh. Tell me about Minecraft
Z: In mine craft I built an awesome tree house which will be hidden as I'll hide it in a waterfall.
I: Anything else?
Z: Goodbye

In Igor's own words. 

Thank you Tori for all your help and support. It's been a busy week for me and as always you've been doing an awesome job keeping the family on track during their week off and the week before that with all the snow. You're the best wife ever.

Have a great week and remember -I don't really remember why I rhyme here, maybe it's cuz I like being a bit queer - ZiaT

link.title: Week 461AZ: First bike to work of the year.

entry.title: Week 460AZ: I'm sad because I won't get to see you
entry.content:
Amelia and Zach are at a sleep over. I got home before Amelia left, and as she was leaving she was all teared up and upset. I went up to her, and held her while she cried:

I: Amelia - what's wrong?
A: I won't get to see you tonight.
I: It's OK, it'll only be till tomorrow
A: How many nights is that?
I: One night
A: No, how about 2 nights.

I'm pretty sure Amelia was just having some trouble counting, but it was quadruple adorable. Always feels good to be loved.

This weekend Zach and I got to see Tori's play. For no good reason the Theater has a bank vault, so we got a selfie!

Post theater we went to the new playground at gasworks. Always fun to watch the sunset at gasworks, and Amelia loved the new playground. In fact, she liked it so much she was furious at me when we had to go home (which Zach was really pining for). Interestingly, I got the brunt of her rage at leaving , and Zach got off as a hero. Very happy to have the older sibling bond.
On the topic of older brothers - Zach decided (after he was bored as heck since he was out of Kindle time) he'd make us a gourmet meal.   He did a great job setting the table, and getting drinks, and he even had a very creative entree (cold ramen noodles pre-seasoned with salt). Zach - super nice work!!!



Amelia is a sweet heart, see her in her self colored Fedora,and in her high heels and dresses. She's a looker.  She's also an academic, see her starting to write out her name.



Have a great week and remember - Your kids grow up one time, missing it is a crime - ZiaT!

link.title: Week 460AZ: I'm sad because I won't get to see you

entry.title: Week 459AZ: OMG - That's some serious snow
entry.content:
I thought last week was snowy. This week has been so much snow school was cancelled 3 days and late start 2 days. It's snowing again tonight so school's already cancelled Monday.

This weekend I got into the snow with the kids. Which worked out as tweaking my back while making a snowman with Amelia, recovering and then ripping out my back doing some snow fort building with Zach. I'm typing this wearing a back support, here's hoping to a pleasant tomorrow. In good news, one thing that really helps with my back is going to the gym, and I've been slacking so this will be a good reminder.



Beyond snow, Zach had a sleep over with a new friend (Sol), and Amelia let me go sledding with her, and do tattoos and face painting. I got some face painting just like Amelia.












In Amelia's own words: 

Once upon a time there lived a little girl named a Amelia, and then she fell down, the end.
I love you Daddy, you can be my best friend.


In Zach's own words: 

Z: I'm a dildo
I: What!? Don't say that.
Z: Huh, what does it mean?
I: It's a thing for sex, trust me you don't want to be a dildo.
Z: OK.


Oh yeah, and Tori made an awesome leg of lamb.















Have a great week and remember -Don't stop going to the gym, or you'll stop being trim, and your back will hurt on a whim - ZiaT!

link.title: Week 459AZ: OMG - That's some serious snow

entry.title: Week 458AZ: Mommy I love you!
entry.content:
Tori's been very very very busy getting her play to open, so I've been trying to get home at a reasonable time for a baby sitter or Miga or Tori  kid-handoff.  It's also been a busy work week.

The kids (and I) missed Tori so much, they even made an emergency sign:














With Mom out I spent one night making slides. Actually - Zach came up with a recipe that I got to actually execute. Tasty sliders, from our own cow.




We had some freak snow, and the kids loved getting out and playing in it:








Amelia loves to be active, and we got out do some roller skating. It blows my mind both how physical Amelia is, and how brave she is. She's very goal focused, and she understands the importance of practice.




It wasn't all cooking and playing, I got into the video games, which is really a terrible addiction.
At first I was playing with Zach, but he got bored and wandered off. I kept playing, and Amelia came down and yelled at me:

Stop watching TV or I'll punch you in the face. 

Maybe not the nicest thing to say, but probably a good idea that I stop watching TV.

Amelia's Story in her own words

Once upon a time there lived a little girl whose name was Amelia. She went to school, she got a bummer (it means she got everything wrong, she failed a new class that every girl has. She failed her homework, and she was late for class, and she had to get all of her good things off her, and had to put on her bad things, and she had to take off all her badges because she was bad).

Then her mom gave her a giant jumbo allowell doll, and then it fixed everything.  She didn't even have to build it.

(Wow, wasn't expecting that -- Maybe it's not all sugar and spice and all things nice up there) 

Zach's Story in her own words

Zach says Hi. Zach had many baby sitters this week. Day after day, it was really annoying because he missed his Mommy.


Have a great week, and remember - If you smell like poo, you should check your shoe. Failing that, see if there's a kangaroo - ZiaT!

entry.title: Week 457AZ: Magic Magic
entry.content:
Today is Sunday and Igor came home from his magic festival. Igor was in Ohio for MagiFest, a major magician conference from Thursday to Sunday, where he got to see one of the worlds greatest living magicians - Juan Tamariz.

Juan is almost 80 years old,  but has the energy of a 20 year old -- it's incredible.  One of Juan's five points in magic is you have to project your inner love for the art of magic, which is something I do even without his instruction - but to watch him do it -- incredible.

There were other cool performers too - Yann Frish was super cool.  Especially when you got to see how the act works from behind the curtain. So fascinating.

While waiting for one of the lecture I was able to teach a guy how to do some rubber band magic - that made my day.  After a lecture a 12 year old showed me how to do some advanced rubber band magic. I asked him where I could learn more about it and he told me, oh I just made it up for the conference, I wanted to show new stuff.

I also was inspired to do magic, and did some impromptu magic at the restaurants, hotels and even waiting in line to board the plane, and for my airplane seat mates.


Zach Here. 

I went to iHop alot the last week, I went a bunch - 2 or 3 times a week, and it was awesome - that's the magic of iHop. Yeah (Tori's been busy getting her play read aswell).  I had a playdate today with my best friend (Kai) and that's about all.

My dad got me started and now I can play video games with Kai at his house, we can see the games we're playing together and talk to each other through our headsets - pretty awesome.

At school, we made some fossils, we will open them on Tuesday (Monday is a holiday)

We currently moved tables. I was the only one in the class who stayed in my seat. Someone moved across the table. They always get stuck with the worst kid in class - now they're sitting with Zach.

Back to Dad,

It was freezing in Ohio, brutal snow storm. What warmed my heart was hearing that Amelia was super upset that Daddy wasn't home and she wanted a hug.  While it's a great story when I came home, Amelia was more interested in her Kindie then playing with me.

entry.title: Week 456AZ: Sunny in January
entry.content:
This has been a busy week at work, but a few highlights.

Private Magic Lessons - I took my first private lesson, and that was awesome!  My coach is really good at coins, so he has me working some coin routines I haven't been doing in years. He's also cleaned up some of my rubber band work, and brought me some great ideas on how to practice.

Electric Bike Rental- Jump bikes are a new dockless e-bike share in Seattle. The bikes can supposedly go 19mph, which is pretty dang fun, and they are now available in my neighborhood. Looking forward to taking one to work and seeing how it does on the hills.


Playing with the kids this weekend - Tori is pretty busy working on her play, so I had the kids for the perfect weather weekend. On Saturday morning we headed out to the park where Amelia played on the swings and Zach played pokeman go. That afternoon we had Kai and Ciel over, and I made sushi bowls for dinner - a wonderful day! Sunday was another day of fun. It started by spending hours trying to get the Kai and Zach to play Minecraft over the interwebs (and trying to hear each others living rooms).  Then Sunday afternoon Amelia and I went for a nice long walk to the far away playground (Zach stayed home since he can call me on Alexa).

I didn't take many pictures this weekend, so I'll recycle some old ones.

entry.title: Week 455AZ: Video Edition
entry.content:
This was the last week of the kids holidays! We had lots of fun. and I'll  trying posting some videos for a change:


Amelia loves her "ball pool", and she loves sword fighting (although she's still got some learning to do).   Amelia and I went to a pretty sweet disco/country party where we got to dance and listen to live music.   



Zach loves his new XBox, and we also started playing Pokeman Go together. Looking forward to 
many new Dad and Zach adventures. 


I also got some more time in on magic - very excited about getting

entry.title: Happy Jump in the lake day 2019
entry.content:
Another year, another jump.    I jump in the lake to remind myself that even though the resistance tells me "something awful will happen" or "you'll hate this" or "oh my god are you crazy" it's all a big fat lie, and I'll be fine.  It's the difference between pain and suffering, "Physical pain" which is real, often tiny, and quickly acclimatized to, and "Mental Suffering" which is completely in your head, often huge, and if left untreated  expands to ovewhelm you.



This year, Zach and Amelia weren't willing to jump, (and I was OK with that), but they did have to come (which they were OK with).  After the jump Zach and Amelia played in the park. As a parent nothing makes me happier then seein Zach and Amelia playing together, and see Zach pushing Amelia on the swing

I'm not into resolutions, but this year will have goals around getting my weight under control, building my meditation habit, and taking magic to the next level.

link.title: Happy Jump in the lake day 2019

entry.title: Week 452AZ: Blogbing for Xbox
entry.content:
Zach wants an XBox and Dad wants to have a weekly family journal.  I think we've got a win/win situation coming on. Lots of good pictures to share.

In Zach's own words ...

Zach is becoming popular with the ladies (no, I mean technically I am good friends). Zach also discovered the magical wold of modded mine craft. For you technopeasants out there (including Dad), modded minecraft is: Voxeltov.

Zach had another story to tell...

Once upon a time there was a little girl, her name was Amelia. One day she decided to play a video game. She got completely addicted. So, Igor had to take the video game away. Amelia was not very happy so she ended up throwing her kindie at Igor (/Dad), and she lost video games for the rest of the day.


In Amelia's words. ..

We went to the last circus class, and I was the only one there, and I got to show off doing trampoline, and circus ball.  We also did a few circus classes


In Igor's words ... 

It has been a crazy quarter. We had lots of fun, and I've got some tales to tell.  A super fun night was a few weeks ago when Tori and I went on a date to a cocktail party. Tori and I dressed up and ate lots of appetizers, drank lots of booze, and entertained folks with magic. 

This week I'm off work, and we've had some mini adventures - handing out chocolate, getting to see Amelia at Dance and Circus, getting to see Zach's Christmas concert, and getting to see Zach and Amelia at Karate.   Pretty fun stuff.

Have a great week, and remember - Even if you're a magician, you can have lots of ambition.- ZiaT

entry.title: Week 447AZ: Zach's post: Cookies are da best
entry.content:
Zach's contributing to this week's post, and Igor is looking forward to getting the kids more involved:

From Zach:

Happy Thanksgiving everyone (in 2 days). Wreck it Ralph is coming out tomorrow I think and x-mas is sooner then you expect #happy_face. What is your favorite part about x-mas? Leave it below in the comments.

From Amelia:

I really enjoyed karate, and now I have to do homework - that's what making me so uncomfortable.

From Igor:

Igor was out last week to Canada, which was a fun trip, and he got to see Yelena, Justin, Sammy and Rada and Baltasar.

Zach and Amelia are in Karate, and they got the first stripe on their white belt. Today, the kids even got to spar for the first time - very cool.

Igor's been super busy at work as he gets ready to launch a very cool feature this coming Tuesday - you'll see more soon.

We're dog sitting Ryan's dog Kirby, and we're enjoying it greatly.
